title: Brownies Two Ways
subtitle: One pan classic, one pan with mix-ins — makes two 8x8-inch pans

sections.title: You will need
list: Chopped walnuts or pecans (optional) – up to 2 c total with chips
Chocolate chips (optional) – up to 2 c total with nuts

sections.title: Instructions
list: If using nuts as mix-ins, toast them first.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line two 8x8-inch pans with parchment and grease lightly.
Melt the butter and let it cool slightly.
In a large bowl, combine the sugar and melted butter. Stir until smooth and glossy.
Whisk together the cocoa, baking powder, and salt in the small bowl. Stir this mixture into the sugar-butter mixture along with the vanilla extract.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. You're done using the beaters after this step.
Add 1/2 C water and scrape the sides of the bolw.  Stir until smooth and fully combined.
Add the flour and stir until just combined.
Divide the batter evenly into two bowls (approximately 950–975g each).
Toss the optional mix-ins in a spoonful of flour. Stir them into only one of the two bowls of batter.
Spoon each batter into its own prepared pan and smooth the tops.
Bake both pans for 25–30 minutes, rotating halfway through. A toothpick inserted in the center should come out with moist crumbs.
Cool in the pans for 15 minutes, then lift out using parchment and cool completely on a rack.
Glaze or frost if desired. Store airtight, or freeze one pan for later.
